Stones

From Peragro Tempus Wiki

Stones as Measurement

Stones are a measurement of weight in Phoria (corrisponding to about half a kg). Generally, merchants obtain new stones from smiths who craft them to the weight of existing stones. Some of the most prized stones are obtained from the Vaalorian Library, which keeps a set of reference stones and sells official duplicates with the Vaalorian Seal carved into it.

Merchents commonly keep additional types of stones. Some of the most common are Quarter Stones and Tenstones (tenth stones) which are proportionlly smaller. Some merchants, especially those who work in herbs, will have weights as fine as one-hundredth of a stone. These are used commonly in marketplaces. Counterfeits are often employed by criminals trying to cheat patrons out of extra cash, thus careful buyers often check the maker's mark on a merchant's stone and verify it's legitimacy. Similarly even travelling merchants will often keep a stone on them to verify a trading partner's weights.

Category: Economy
